column4: As a debian user of many years, I have a silly question. I'm contemplating installing Ubuntu on a client machine. If I do that, and a future version of Ubuntu is released, can they boot from the new CD and upgrade their workstation without supervision?
it works the same as debain soo in that respect if you would let them unsupervised with a debain apt-get upgrade then yes
Does the CD do this itself, or do they need to get their hands dirty?
a little dirty but not anything you cant show them in 5 seconds
Except that "show" involves a trip of 3000km :-)
so if they can add the cd to sources.list on their own then it should be all gravy
Does the CD allow you to boot from it and detect a previous install and offer to upgrade?
Hmm, might need to play a little with VMWare before I let them loose :)
, will they have internet ? they can upgrade via the apt-get dist-upgrade option too
that might be the best option for them then
I was attracted to Ubuntu because of the regular CD release. I'll have another think about this.
